document.docAuthor: Hughes, Lauren E. & Peart, Rachael A.
document.masterDocTitle: New species and new records of Ampithoidae (Peracarida: Amphipoda) from Australian Waters

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: New species and new records of Ampithoidae (Peracarida: Amphipoda) from Australian Waters

subSubSection.paragraph:
Grubia brevidactyla Chevreux, 1907 : 417
.—Chevreux, 1908 : 517 , figs 30–32 .—Schellenberg, 1938 : 87 .
Cymadusa brevidactyla
.—?Ledoyer, 1978 : 223 , fig. 11 .—Myers, 1985 : 29 , figs 18–19 .—Myers, 1986 b: 66 .—Myers, 1986 a: 287 .—Myers, 1989 : 66 .—Myers, 1990 : 156 .—Myers, 1995 : 38 .—Myers, 1997 : 108 .—Barnard & Karaman, 1991 : 105 .— Ortiz & Lalana, 1999 : 193 .

Material examined. Western Australia :
22 specimens
, AM P. 80005 , inner lagoon, Ningaloo Reef (
21 ° 53 ’09”S
113 ° 59 ’ 26 ”E
), 2.6 m , algae,
19 June 2008
, coll. L.E. Hughes (MI WA 988 ).

Christmas Island :
1 specimen
, AM P. 81795 , dive site “Chicken Farm” (
10 ° 24 ’ 56 ”S
105 ° 41 ’03”E
), 12 m , fine red algae and dead coral
Acropora
sp.,
23 October 2008
, coll. J.K. Lowry (MI WA 930 );
2 specimens
, AM P. 81798 , dive site “The Morgue” (
10 ° 24 ’ 56 ”S
105 ° 41 ’03”E
), 9.5 m , rubble,
23 October 2008
, coll. L.E. Hughes (MI WA 939 );

10 ° 28 ’ 26 ”S
105 ° 33 ’ 29 ”E
), 15.5 m , rubble,
21 October 2008
, coll. L.E. Hughes (MI WA 904 );
3 specimens
, AM P. 81797 , south of Smiths Point (
10 ° 26 ’02”S
105 ° 39 ’ 38 ”E
), 11 m , rubble with sediment,
20 October 2008
, coll. J.K. Lowry and K.B. Attwood (MI WA 891 );
5 specimens
, AM P. 81799 , West White Beach (
10 ° 27 ’ 41 ”S
105 ° 34 ’ 54 ”E
), 8 m , dead coral encrusted with epiphytes,
18 October 2008
, coll. L.E. Hughes and K.B. Attwood (MI WA 871 ).

sp. coral rubble with silt,

4 specimens
, AM P. 82140 , off “Two Trees Beach” dive site, West Island (
12 °05’05”S
96 ° 52 ’ 54 ”E
), 8 m , rubble and coarse green algae,
7 October 2008
, coll. L.E. Hughes (MI WA 782 );
9 specimens
, AM P. 82141 , northern side of Direction Island (
12 °05’05”S
96 ° 52 ’ 54 ”E
), 8 m , large pieces of coral rubble and sediment,

12 °05’ 48 ”S
96 ° 51 ’ 31 ”E
), 7.2 m , rubble,

, coll. K.B. Attwood, (MI WA 795 );
3 specimens
, AM P. 82143 , coral bommie near wreck of the Catalina, near Horsburgh Island (
12 °05’ 48 ”S
96 ° 51 ’ 31 ”E
), 7.2 m , rubble sticks with epiphytes,
9 October 2008
, coll. L.E. Hughes, (MI WA 796 );
4 specimens
, AM P. 82144 , northeast section of the lagoon (
12 °06’ 22 ”S
96 ° 52 ’ 12 ”E

, coll. K.B. Attwood (MI WA 801 );
3 specimens
, AM P. 82145 , northeast section of the lagoon (
12 °06’ 22 ”S
96 ° 52 ’ 12 ”E
), 5.8 m , large coral rubble,
9 October 2008
, coll. J.K. Lowry, (MI WA 806 );
6 specimens
, AM P. 82146 , coral bommie near wreck of the Catalina, near Horsburgh Island (
12 °05’ 48 ”S
96 ° 51 ’ 31 ”E

96 ° 49 ’ 43 ”E

), 9.5 m , rubble,
12 October 2008

7 specimens
, AM P. 82150 , centre of lagoon (
12 °08’ 50 ”S
96 ° 51 ’ 13 ”E
), 8 m , dead coral
Acropora
sp. with red epiphytic algae,
14 October 2008
, coll. K.B. Attwood and L.E. Hughes (MI WA 845 );

, AM P. 82151 , “Surf Shack Drift” dive site, western side of West Island (
12 °09’ 35 ”S

15 October 2008
, coll. J.K. Lowry and L.E. Hughes (MI WA 859 ).

Remarks. Specimens from Christmas and Cocos (Keeling) Islands are relatively small, 5.7 mm , similar to Mauritius specimens at 6.5 mm (Ledoyer, 1978 ). Specimens from Western Australia and the Northern Territory span a larger size range with individuals reaching 7.0 mm.
